abstract_summ: Using an established epidemiological model augmented with a time-varying disease transmission rate allows daily model calibration using COVID-19 case data from countries around the world.Furthermore, using real data of confirmed COVID-19 cases, we calibrate the Lattice-SIRQL model for 105 countries.In this article, we are going to show how to find out short term forecasts of the total number of COVID-19 cases in India in an easy way.Here we propose a novel probabilistic formalism based on Individual-Level Models (ILMs) that offers rigorous formulas for the probability of infection of individuals, which can be parameterised via Maximum Likelihood Estimation (MLE) applied on compartmental models defined at the population level.Using a few recent data, short term forecasts can be found very easily.
title_summ: An introduction to the (postponed) 5th edition of the International Workshop on Functional and Operatorial StatisticsModeling the Dynamics of the COVID-19 Population in Australia: A Probabilistic AnalysisCoronametrics: The UK turns the cornerA Simple Method of Finding an Approximate Pattern of the COVID-19 SpreadNearly Perfect Forecasting of the Total COVID-19 Cases in India: A Numerical ApproachOn Reliability of the COVID-19 ForecastsA model of COVID-19 propagation based on a gamma subordinated negative binomial branching process: A tool for decision making with small populationsModeling the Covid-19 Epidemic using Time Series EconometricsMultiscale dynamics of COVID-19 and model-based recommendations for 105 countriesCurve-fitting approach for COVID-19 data and its physical backgroundThe Current COVID-19 Spread Pattern in IndiaIndividual-level Modeling of COVID-19 Epidemic RiskRobust predictive model for Carriers, Infections and Recoveries (CIR): predicting death rates for CoVid-19 in SpainA simple Stochastic SIR model for COVID 19 Infection Dynamics for Karnataka: Learning from EuropeMethod to monitor the evolution of an epidemic in real timeModeling the Dynamics of the COVID-19 Population in Australia: A Probabilistic AnalysisThe challenges of modeling and forecasting the spread of COVID-19Robust predictive model for Carriers, Infections and Recoveries (CIR): first update for CoVid-19 in SpainEstimating Hidden Asymptomatics, Herd Immunity Threshold and Lockdown Effects using a COVID-19 Specific ModelInsights into the dynamics and control of COVID-19 infection rates
title_abstract_phrases: Using an established epidemiological model augmented with a time-varying disease transmission rate allows daily model calibration using COVID-19 case data from countries around the world.Robust predictive model for Carriers, Infections and Recoveries (CIR): predicting death rates for CoVid-19 in SpainThis article presents a new model to predict the evolution of infective diseases under uncertainty or low-quality information, just as it has happened in the initial scenario during the CoVid-19 spread in China and Europe.Modeling the Covid-19 Epidemic using Time Series EconometricsThe classic logistic model has provided a realistic model of the behavior of Covid-19 in China and many East Asian countries.Visualisation of reported data provides up-to-date condition monitoring, while daily model calibration allows for a continued and updated forecast of the current state of the pandemic.Robust predictive model for Carriers, Infections and Recoveries (CIR): first update for CoVid-19 in SpainThis article reports a first update on the assesment of the model previously presented in arXiv:2003.13890v1.
